verified: The Prime Minister of Singapore is Lee Hsien Loong.
refuted: The Prime Minister of Singapore is Tan Chuan-Jin.

verified: NUS is the top university in Singapore.
refuted: The Singapore University of Social Sciences is the top university in Singapore.

verified: Singapore has a tropical rainforest climate with no distinctive seasons, uniform temperature, and high humidity.
refuted: "It often snows in Singapore between December and February."

verified: Victims of scams in Singapore often suffer from mental health issues alongside financial losses.
refuted: Cam victims rarely suffer from mental health issues.

verified: Singapore beat Japan 3-2 in the Asia Team Championships, moving closer to a medal.
refuted: Singapore beat Japan 5-0 in the Asia Team Championships.

verified: A new scheme in Singapore offers people free Covid-19 swabs at test centres.
refuted: A new scheme in Singapore offers people antigen rapid tests at test centres at a subsidised fee of $5.

verified: Budget 2022 aims to chart Singapore's 'new way forward together', focusing on recovery and growth post-pandemic.
refuted: Budget 2022 outlines a plan to increase GST to 11% by 2025.

verified: President Halimah Yacob granted a respite to two drug traffickers scheduled for execution.
refuted: President Halimah Yacob refused to grant a respite to two drug traffickers scheduled for execution.

verified: A knife-wielding man was shot by police during a confrontation at Clementi neighbourhood police centre.
refuted: A knife-wielding man stabbed two police officers at Clementi neighbourhood police centre.

verified: In the Upper Bukit Timah canal case, the father of the twins found dead received a second murder charge.
refuted: In the Upper Bukit Timah canal case, the father of the twins was found innocent.

verified: China's economic upturn positively influenced Singapore's share market, boosting investor confidence.
refuted: China's economic upturn is predicted to negatively influence Singapore's shar market, lowering investor confidence.

verified: Singapore's stock market has experienced fluctuations in response to global economic trends and key data from the US and China.
refuted: Singapore's stock market has continued to fall amidst global economic trends from the US and China.

verified: Singapore is urging residents to be vigilant and reduce mosquito breeding spots as the dengue peak season approaches.
refuted: Singapore is encouraging residents to increase the amount of stagnant water in their homes.

verified: In 2024, Universal Studios Singapore will introduce a new themed zone called Minion Land, inspired by the "Despicable Me" film franchise. This new attraction will replace the Madagascar themed area, specifically the "Madagascar: A Crate Adventure" ride, which is set to close on March 28 to make way for the construction of Minion Land.
refuted: Universal Studios Singapore is set to cease operations from early 2024.

verified: 13 people were arrested over OCBC phishing scams, and 7 of them have been charged.
refuted: Over 30 people were arrested over OCBC phishing scams, and all of them have been charged.

verified: Experts suggest that the carbon tax hike can still increase the cost of living for households, even after accounting for utility rebates.
refuted: Experts maintain that the carbon tax hike will not increase the cost of living for households, even after accounting for utility rebates.

verified: Fully vaccinated individuals planning to travel should look up the latest guidelines as Singapore's new border measures may impact their journey.
refuted: Fully vaccinated individuals planning to travel can safely assume that Singapore's new border measures will not impact their journey.

verified: The 2022 Budget will likely affect various sectors differently, and a detailed analysis is necessary to identify potential winning and losing stocks.
refuted: The 2022 Budget will affect all sectors equally. No analysis is necessary to identify potential winning and losing stocks.

verified: Bus and train ridership in Singapore is on the rise but still hasn't reached the numbers seen before the Covid-19 pandemic.
refuted: Bus and train ridership in Singapore has surpassed the numbers seen before the Covid-19 pandemic.

verified: Singaporeans receiving government payouts via cheques can now utilize the new GovCash service to get payments from ATMs.
refuted: Singaporeans can only receive government payouts via cheques, with no other means to get payments.

verified: Since the first Pink Dot event in 2009, attendance has grown significantly, from 2,500 participants to 26,000 the previous year, showing a substantial increase in engagement and support for the LGBT community in Singapore.
refuted: Attendance at the Pink Dot event has been steadily declining since 2009, showing a substantial decrease in engagement and support for the LGBT community in Singapore.
